name: retroassembly
description: The personal retro game collection cabinet in your browser. Join us on Discord https://discord.gg/gwaKRAYG6t
readme_summary: RetroAssembly is a web-based retro game collection cabinet that allows users to play classic games from various consoles directly in their browser. It features automatic box art detection, save synchronization, rewind functionality (for some emulators), spatial navigation, visual enhancements via shaders, and on-screen virtual controllers.
key_features: Play retro games in the browser
Automatic box art and cover detection
primary_use_case: Playing retro games in a browser-based environment, either through the official hosted version or by self-hosting with Docker.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a grand, ornate cabinet filled with glowing game cartridges representing various retro consoles. A beam of light emanates from the cabinet, projecting a vibrant scene of classic 8-bit characters battling on a pixelated landscape onto a living room wall. A child sits on the floor, controller in hand, completely immersed in the game. Subtle UI elements float around the projected image, showing save states and emulator settings. The repository name, 'RetroAssembly,' is subtly etched onto the cabinet's frame. The scene is bathed in warm, nostalgic light. This should be a 3D isometric illustration with rich details and a vibrant color palette.

name: vibetest-use
description: Vibetest MCP - automated QA testing using Browser-Use agents
readme_summary: The Vibetest Use repository provides an automated QA testing solution for websites using Browser-Use agents. It includes an MCP server that launches multiple agents to identify UI bugs, broken links, accessibility issues, and other technical problems, suitable for both live and local development environments.
primary_use_case: Automated QA testing of websites for UI bugs, broken links, and accessibility issues.
cover_image_prompt: A team of tiny robot mechanics meticulously inspecting a giant, glowing website interface. Each robot uses specialized tools to test different aspects of the site, like checking for broken links, accessibility issues, and UI bugs. The website floats in the air, powered by visible data streams. Small screens display code snippets and test results. The scene is set in a clean, futuristic workshop with bright, focused lighting. Digital particles highlight the flow of data and the robots' actions. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and clear details.

name: zee
description: A modern text editor for the terminal written in Rust
readme_summary: Zee is a modern, experimental text editor for the terminal written in Rust, inspired by Emacs. It emphasizes performance, aiming for 100 FPS rendering with asynchronous operations for tasks like syntax highlighting and file I/O. It uses Tree-sitter for incremental parsing, supports multi-buffer editing, and offers features like fuzzy file search and a rope-based buffer implementation.
key_features: Tree-sitter for syntax highlighting and validation
Fast recursive file search with fuzzy matching
Local file picker with directory navigation
primary_use_case: Terminal-based text editing and code development.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled calligrapher in a futuristic workshop, meticulously crafting lines of code onto a glowing terminal screen. The calligrapher uses a special brush that instantly transforms their strokes into perfectly formatted text with vibrant syntax highlighting. Behind them, a complex network of interconnected ropes represents the underlying data structure, each strand glowing with activity as the code is edited. Small screens display real-time performance metrics and code validation results. The scene is bathed in soft, focused lighting, creating a sense of precision and artistry. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with clean lines and a vibrant color scheme.

name: discordo
description: A lightweight, secure, and feature-rich Discord terminal (TUI) client.
readme_summary: Discordo is a lightweight, secure, and feature-rich terminal-based Discord client. It aims to provide a configurable and efficient way to access Discord through a terminal user interface, supporting features like attachments, notifications, and 2-Factor authentication.
primary_use_case: Accessing and interacting with Discord through a terminal interface.
cover_image_prompt: A skilled typist sits at a vintage terminal, their fingers flying across the keys, composing messages that instantly appear within a vibrant, bustling Discord server visualized as a holographic cityscape. The terminal glows with subtle Discord branding, and digital particles flow from the keyboard to the cityscape, representing the seamless communication. Small UI elements showing Discord channels and message previews subtly float around the scene. The composition is clean and focused, with a cool blue and purple color scheme. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with rich details and vibrant colors.

name: blurr
description: AI agents can now use real Android, just like a human.
readme_summary: The repository provides an AI agent named Panda for Android that can autonomously understand natural language commands and operate a phone's UI. It uses the Android Accessibility Service to interact with the device and LLMs for high-level reasoning and planning, enabling automation of complex, multi-step tasks across different applications.
key_features: Intelligent UI Automation using Android Accessibility Service
Multi-agent system architecture written in Kotlin
primary_use_case: Automating tasks on Android devices using natural language commands.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a friendly panda bear sitting in front of an Android phone, skillfully navigating the screen with its paws. The phone displays various app icons, and the panda is shown effortlessly switching between them, completing tasks like sending messages, ordering food, and managing schedules. Subtle digital elements, such as glowing UI elements and data streams, emanate from the phone, highlighting the AI's ability to understand and execute commands. The scene is set in a cozy, modern living room with soft, warm lighting. The image should be in a 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details, conveying the ease and efficiency of AI-powered phone automation.

name: protector
description: Real-time privacy protection for smart glasses
readme_summary: The repository provides a real-time privacy protection layer for smart glasses applications. It filters camera input, anonymizes faces, manages consent through voice detection, and outputs a compliant video stream. This allows developers to build privacy-conscious AI, social, and enterprise applications using smart glasses.
key_features: Anonymizes faces (blur or solid ellipse masking)
primary_use_case: Real-time privacy protection for smart glasses applications.
cover_image_prompt: Imagine a skilled artisan carefully crafting lenses for a pair of smart glasses. As the artisan polishes each lens, it gains the ability to automatically blur faces and redact sensitive information in the wearer's view. The artisan works in a bright, clean workshop filled with digital tools and holographic displays showing privacy settings. Small code snippets and data visualizations float around the scene, subtly connecting the craft to software. The repository name, 'Protector,' is subtly etched into the workbench. The image should be in 3D isometric illustration style with vibrant colors and rich details.
